alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 25 at 8:12PM CDT until April 27 at 4:20PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins, agricultural lands along the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet by early Tuesday morning, then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon to a stage of 17.6 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 20.1 Mon 6PM 17.6 17.6 18.2 20.5 1 AM 4/26 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
